The obstacle is the way.
You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
He who angers you conquers you.
Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
Happiness and freedom begin with a clear understanding of one principle: some things are within our control, and some things are not.
No man is free who is not master of himself.
To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
It does not matter what you bear, but how you bear it.
Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
Self-control is strength. Right thought is mastery. Calmness is power.
You become what you give your attention to.
Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.
First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
Make the mind tougher by exposing it to adversity.
The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
Difficulty shows what men are.
The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you.
If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
While we wait for life, life passes.
Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not but rejoices for those which he has.
What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
It is not things themselves that disturb us, but our opinions about them.
Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior.
Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
Freedom is the only worthy goal in life.
Only the educated are free.
The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
You don't have to turn this into something. It doesn't have to upset you.
Be like the rock that the waves keep crashing over. It stands unmoved and the raging of the sea falls still around it.
Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
We live only now. Everything else is either past or is unknown.
The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
He who is brave is free.
Nothing endures but change.
Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
No great thing is created suddenly.
What we do now echoes in eternity.
We are more often frightened than hurt.
To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.
If you are pained by external things, it is not they that disturb you, but your own judgment of them.
Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.
He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
Whatever happens at all happens as it should; you will find this true, if you watch narrowly.
He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
Be stoic: just do the right thing. The rest doesn't matter.
Wisdom comes from action.
Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
Sometimes in life we must fight not only without fear, but also without hope.
No man was ever wise by chance.
Control thy passions lest they take vengeance on thee.
Nothing is worth doing pointlessly.
The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
Your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun.
It is not he who reviles or strikes you who insults you, but your opinion that these things are insulting.
A man is as miserable as he thinks he is.
To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
If you seek tranquility, do less. Or do what's essential.
Be ruthless to the things that don't matter.
Don't argue what it means to be a good man. Be one.
Contentment comes not so much from great wealth as from few wants.
The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness depends as little as possible on external things.
The willing are led by fate, the reluctant dragged.
Vex not thy spirit at the course of things; they heed not thy vexation.
Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
Don't demand that things happen as you wish, but wish that they happen as they do happen, and you will go on well.
He who has injured thee was either stronger or weaker than thee. If weaker, spare him; if stronger, spare thyself.
Things are not bad in themselves, but our opinions about things are.
Take full account of what excellences you possess.
Be careful to leave your sons well-instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.
Do not act as if you had ten thousand years to throw away.
From now on, decide to accept nothing unsuitable to a rational being, and to reject nothing suitable to a rational being.
Everything that happens, happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.
A person's worth is measured by the worth of what he values.
Our life is what our thoughts make it.
The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it. Skillful pilots gain their reputation from storms and tempests.
The robbed that smiles, steals something from the thief.
To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions.
One man's joy is another man's sorrow.
A fit body, a calm mind, a house full of love. These things cannot be bought — they must be earned.
Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.
